text:
I think I have found a big bug:
swapping templates from pages in templates v1 doesn't swap correctly (all the content is lost) even if the new template has exactly the same widgets and structure (but v2) :anguished:<@U26B530N6>
ooh that’s honestly terrifying
Can you send me a v1 and v2 example?
I'm definitely super paranoid about clicking that button
Any idea why I’d get this error?
<@U26DA9CQ0> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U26DA9CQ0/FBSFRV1KN/screen_shot_2018-07-18_at_10.57.43_am.png|Screen Shot 2018-07-18 at 10.57.43 AM.png>

I have found several different things that can cause that issue, usually is related to the default content if you have an image field and that kind of stuff. so my recommendation is clean up the default content as max. as possible and try again xD
Huh, it looks like there’s some conflict with a hubdb table, I’m getting this error:
<@U26DA9CQ0> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U26DA9CQ0/FBU3V7QPQ/screen_shot_2018-07-18_at_11.33.18_am.png|Screen Shot 2018-07-18 at 11.33.18 AM.png>
Strange thing is I selected “Do not copy” for all of the images and tables but according to the email I received the operation still tried to copy them.
Maybe because it’s referenced in a module I’m trying to copy.
And you can’t save the modules if the table doesn’t exist.
I’ll just do this the old fashioned way.

yeah, it happened to me too, but if the copy works then the attached files unselected I think they are not copied so it's just the email like not really considering the element selected and parsing all the dependencies or something like that.
if you are using a HubDB selector left it empty and add a conditional so if there is no table selected, ignore the hubL code inside
Good call, thanks Gonzalo.
Hey Jon, in regards to the file revision being off, do you mind dming me a link to the affected file? I can look into what’s possibly happening.
sure one minute I’ll DM you a link
Could you also send me the link as well?

What do you guys think about design manager appending “copy” when you clone a module? It slows me down when I’m trying to scroll to the end of the module name to delete it. I feel like it should just give it the same name and not let you save it unless you change it.
I feel like it should just prompt me for a name instead of making me right click the template. Default can be the original name, and it won't take until you change it in some way.
Might encourage folks to actually use descriptive names instead of just calling everything "(template) copy" or "(template) new" or "(template) 17"
Grumble grumble
I agree with Ian’s suggestion. having it just append copy is annoying when people dont change it.
I would also like a feature where naming a template the same thing as an existing template but with "new" or "copy" at the end melts the user's hard drive
:melting_ice_cream_cone:
I can tell you whatever you did appears to have hit me on my end holy moly, I hit delete and it’s gone fast now. :smile: Thanks

would be great if when editing an html email in DM2 if there was an easy way to copy and paste the styles from module to module

<https://spin.d.pr/jwtA5U+>

related - it would also be awesome if you could select multiple modules and edit those fields for each of the selected modules at the same time (If their current settings are the same) Obviously if they are not the same then it shouldn’t let you change that field when multi-selected
I want to open youtube video in popup using HubSpot CTA
anyone have solution for this
